result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald D Guderyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Concurrent with: Present sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution is held open.
AMENDED 07-07-2015:  Restitution is ordered in the amount of $165 and to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No contact with the victim location or co-actor listed in the criminal complaint.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Court's response to defendant's letter; denied defendant's request to remove DNA order and surcharge.
filed by defendant requesting DNA charges be removed.
filed by Attorney Murray advising he court that an agreement has been reached to set restitution at $165.00 and that the July 28, 2015 hearing may be canceled.
Restitution hearing on July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court.   Defendant Donald D Guderyon did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case was scheduled for a restitution hearing, but the video conference was never scheduled. Attorney Murray stated that he believes a resolution has been reached and requests time to contact his client. Court sets matter over. Defendant to appear by video at next hearing. If parties reach a resolution, Atty Murray to file letter with Court advising that a settlement has been reached and then matter can be taken off the Court's calendar.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Restitution hearing on June 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
From Kettle Moraine Correctional.

Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Donald D Guderyon in court, in custody (Kettle Moraine Correctional - By Video Conference), with attorney Daniel P. Murray.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 36  Months.
Initial Confinement: 18 Months.
Extended Supervision: 18 Months.
Concurrent to:  Present Sentence.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
ny valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim, location or co-actor listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) SURCHARGE:  $ 250
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Restitution held open to the next court date.
Defendant to appear by Video Conference for the restitution hearing.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
